organization.fullName: VA Office of Research and Development

identificationModule.briefTitle: VA Video Connect in HIV Care
identificationModule.officialTitle: VA Video Connect to Improve Access to Multi-disciplinary Specialty Care

leadSponsor.name: VA Office of Research and Development

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this research study is to see how effective the addition of video to home telehealth services is in helping patients with HIV to remain in care, which is vital to management of their illness. The investigators also want to understand how to best put the video to home services into practice.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Veterans in the Infections Disease clinic at the Michael E. DeBakey Veterans Affairs Medical Center (MEDVAMC) will be randomly assigned to either an offer of VA Video Connect (VVC) delivered HIV care or to usual care for HIV. All treatment as usual options for HIV care will be available to all patients in both treatment arms, however only the Veterans in the VVC arm will be actively offered this VA-approved technology.

armGroups.label: VVC
armGroups.description: Option to receive VA Video Connect (VVC) delivery of HIV care.

armGroups.label: Usual Care
armGroups.description: All HIV care available at MEDVAMC will be delivered as usual.

interventions.name: VVC
interventions.description: Telehealth treatment is delivered via VA-approved technology to a patient's computer or mobile device.

primaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of patients who completed at least 1 visit with a primary care or Infectious Diseases provider in each 6 months of the year at least 60 days apart.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of scheduled HIV clinic appointments attended over the year
Number of completed visits for counseling, mental health, and social services during the year.
Percentage of Veterans with HIV on ART whose most recent viral load during the 12-month period was \<200c/mL
Number of ART medication pills dispensed from pharmacy over the year divided by days in year.

otherOutcomes.description: 10-item screening tool to assess alcohol consumption, drinking behaviors and alcohol-related problems. Item responses range from 0-4. Scores range from 0-40. Higher scores indicate more harmful alcohol use.

Brief measure of depression symptoms consisting of 9 items rated from 0-3 (0 = not at all, 1 = several days, 2 = more than half the days, 3 = nearly every day). Scores range from 0 to 27. Higher scores indicate greater depression severity.
Measure of PTSD symptoms. 20 items rated from 0 (not at all) to 4 (extremely). Scores range from 0 to 80. Higher scores = higher symptom severity.

Brief screening tool that assesses cognitive functioning across 8 domains; attention and concentration, executive functions, memory, language, conceptual thinking, calculations and orientation. Scores range from 0-30. Higher scores indicate greater cognitive function.
Last recorded value in medical record during 12 month period
Last recorded value in 12 months period.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patient in the Infectious Diseases clinic at Michael E. DeBakey VA Medical Center (MEDVAMC), Houston, TX, with HIV infection
* At least 18 years of age
* Able to speak English
* Able to consent to the use of VVC

Exclusion Criteria:

* Unable to use or consent to use VVC, due to either significant physical or mental disability
* Incarcerated (though MEDVAMC does not generally provide care for prisoners)

overallOfficials.name: Jan Alexandra Lindsay, PhD
overallOfficials.affiliation: Michael E. DeBakey VA Medical Center, Houston, TX

locations.facility: Michael E. DeBakey VA Medical Center, Houston, TX

Arch Clin Neuropsychol. 2023 May 22;38(4):570-585. doi: 10.1093/arclin/acac104.

Sheinfil AZ, Day G, Walder A, Hogan J, Giordano TP, Lindsay J, Ecker A. Rural Veterans with HIV and Alcohol Use Disorder receive less video telehealth than urban Veterans. J Rural Health. 2024 Jun;40(3):419-429. doi: 10.1111/jrh.12799. Epub 2023 Sep 27.

Gloston GF, Day GA, Touchett HN, Marchant-Miros KE, Hogan JB, Chen PV, Amspoker AB, Fletcher TL, Giordano TP, Lindsay JA. Pivoting to Video Telehealth for Delivery of HIV Care During COVID-19: A Brief Report. Telemed Rep. 2021 Aug 6;2(1):205-210. doi: 10.1089/tmr.2021.0010. eCollection 2021.
